text: On which of the following factor does the viscosity of a liquid depend? i. Nature of the liquid. ii. Temperature of the liquid. iii. Area of the liquid surface
explanation:
The viscosity of a liquid depends on:
* Nature of the liquid: Different liquids have varying viscosities.
* Temperature of the liquid: Higher temperatures generally reduce viscosity.
The area of the liquid surface does not affect viscosity, it is an intrinsic property of the liquid.

text: A body is dropped from a certain height above the ground level, falls with uniform
explanation: For an object falling from a height, theacceleration is constant and is equal to g. This uniform acceleration is produced due to the gravitational force and is known as acceleration due to gravity.

text: When a metal ball is heated through 30oC,its volume becomes 1.0018cm3. If the linear expansivity of the material of the ball is 2.0 x 10-5 K-1, calculate its original volume
explanation:
\(\gamma\) = \(\frac{\delta\ V}{V_1\delta\theta}\)
but \(\gamma\) = 3\(\alpha\) and \(\delta\)V = \(V_2 - V_1\),
making \(V_1\) subject of formula we have
\(V_1 = \frac{V_2}{3\alpha\delta\theta + 1} = \frac{1.0018}{3 \times 2.0 \times 10^{-5} \times 30 + 1}\)= 1\(cm^3\)
\(\therefore\)  the original volume of the metal ball = 1.0000\(cm^3\)
